Tyrael: I just sent Dreadplague on a mission to get us a free Pred 
worker. We have to build a central artillery piece. You will build 
the basis. We need a magna platform to make the gun itself hover, and 
three power stations. The enemy is Unicron, no more, no less. Your 
job will be to supervise the construction. Take the freight barge in 
the cargo bay with you. It should be loaded with all the needed 
material. Here is the location.

The Tripred officer handed his soldier a small datapad containing the 
detailed map of the building site and the plans for the hover cannon. 
It showed the magna platform as a disc rimming the edges of a large 
crater. Inside the crater, three doors opened on three small nuclear 
power stations. In the air, a huge artillery cannon floated like a 
giant arrowhead threatening anyone coming too close.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> wrote:
> : : DeathStar : :
> 
> DeathStar stepped out from the chamber, his new TM2 form glistening 
under the light.
> 
> DeathStar: I'm prepared, sir. Orders?
> 
> 
> Proudwing500k@h... wrote:
> Tyrael waited for Deathstar to come out of CR and reveal his new 
> self. Meanwhile, he had been working on a program to coordinate the 
> defenses of all three bases.
> 
> Tyrael: Dreadplague, report to the labs. I have an assignment for 
you.
> 
> Dreadplague reported a few nanocycles afterwards, weary from the 
> first encounter with the minions.
> 
> Tyrael: Daughter, it has begun. Darkangel is assisting the Maximals 
> against the minions of Unicron -because it is him behind all this- 
> and time is running out. I need you to bring this datadrive to 
> Hydras, and to ask him to send one of his men. Come back here when 
> you are done, with the Predacon, if possible.
> 
> 
>
